N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 52.2 - Specifications and requirements

State Regulations

Such device must meet the following requirements: (a) It must operate independently of the
ignition switch. (b) It must either
operate independently of the turn signal unit, or if it is combined with that
unit its method of operation must be different from that unit. (c) It must be installed so that it uses the
turn signal lights as the hazard warning lights. (d) It must have a pilot indicator light
which flashes only when the device is in use. (e) A turn signal indicator having two
separate pilot indicators may be used as the pilot hazard warning indicator, and this would not be considered as being contrary to the foregoing
subdivision. Both indicators must flash simultaneously. (f) In all other cases, a separate flashing
indicator must be used, and it must be red in color and at least equivalent in
size to a one-half inch diameter circle. (g) The flasher must be able to flash at
least two of the remaining bulbs if one or more bulbs fail. (h) The flasher must be a variable load
flasher or one which accomplishes the same function as a variable load
flasher. Notes
